THE MACMILLAN COMPAINTY • 60 fifth avenue, new york 10011
*■' . TELEPHONE: 620-4500
, "March 23, 1964
Mr. James A. Fellows
Assistant Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington 36, D. C.
Dear Mr. Fellows:
Your letter requesting permission to use some of our material in the Voice
of America’s English Through Poetry series has been referred to this de¬
partment for reply.
Rights to Vachel Lindsay’s ’The Flower Fed Buffaloes’ are handled by
Appleton-Century-Crofts, 34 West 33 Street, New York 1. Those for E.A.
Robinson’s ’Richard Cory* are controlled by Charles Scribner’s Sons,
597 Fifth Avenue, New York 17.
We have only the United States market for W. B. Yeats. For other markets,
permission should be obtained from:
A.P. Watt & Son
Hastings House
Norfolk Street
London W. C. 2, England
We are writing Miss Marianne Moore for her permission to comply with
your request and will be in touch with you as soon as we hear. The
British Empire rights to her work are controlled by
Faber & Faber Lid.
24 Russell Squa^re
London, W. C. 1, England
Sincerely yours,
As* T* v" % Qv\
(Miss) Pendleton Garrison
Permissions Department
